text:
Hi I'm Bart of Bart's Fish Tails and
this is Juul, my lovely daughter, she's

one-and-a-half years old and today we're
going to make this delicious recipe of

Jamie Oliver which is oven tray
baked salmon with new potatoes and

seasonal veggies. So this dish is light
its, nutritious. The potatoes and the

beans, sort of structure, gives a bit of
sweetness to the dish. We have the herbs,
we have the lemon which gives a bit of an acid kick and freshness

to the dish. We have of course the salmon
crunchy crispy from the outside and

juicy and tender from the inside. So for
this stage guys I'm using salmon and why

because it's a really oily fish,  it
contains a lot of omega threes, and this

is really good for your kids. And if you
buy seafood,  if you buy salmon,  make sure

you buy them coming from a sustainable
source. So first pre-heat your oven on

230 degrees Celsius or 450 on fahrenheit.
Okay so first thing, we take a big pan

and fill it up with some cold water and
bring it to a boil with some salt and

the first job is to clean the potatoes.
So we have here some water,

okay you're okay, then we're going to clean
them with a brush from the outside.

So what I use is like 700 grams of new
potatoes. We leave the skin on.

Okay, so potatoes. We have three types of beans
today. We have the green beans, we have

runner beans, yep the green beans, and we
have the yellow French beans. So

the first job I'm doing is get rid of
tips. So we start with the runner beans.

I cut off the tops of the runner
beans, but you cut it until the side of

the bean, you try to get rid of this
vein at the outside. But if it's really

fresh it will be difficult to find it. So
the better the beans the less vein you

will find. So I used for this
dish we have like

of all beans we use like 100 grams. First
I start with the runner beans,

I slice them around every four
centimetres. So cut them in these

bite-size pieces.
Okay, so we're cooking and boiling

the potatoes right now. So what you do,
you get them like 10-12 minutes until

they're nearly done, and as soon as
they're nearly done we're going to add the

veggies. So all the veggies including the
potatoes will be ready at the same time.

Okay so as soon as all the veggies have
been properly cooked we drain them into

a colander. So the next step is you just
add all these perfectly boiled veggies

into an oven tray. So scatter over the
peas. Add some butter, use like 20 grams

of butter. Give it like 1 tablespoon of olive oil
drizzle it over all the beautiful ingredients.
So next step I've got 2 lemons.

I'm going to use the zest of two
lemons. So scatter this in the tray.

Next step is the lemon, so what we
use is the lemon juice and use your

fingers to catch up the pips. So what I
also do is use a bit of the lemon juice

to drizzle over the salmon. So now I give
it a toss with my with my hand.

It's important that all the ingredients
are still warm, so all the flavours are

getting properly infused. So
next step I take a handful of basil,

fresh basil, and I get rid of the stalks,
so just take the leaves.

Nice! Okay so basil, dill, fresh dill. Half
of the basil and half of the fresh dill and
I add this to the tray. So now we're here with the salmon. We're going to score the

fillet lightly into the skin. Bit of
olive oil, and now I use the other half of

the fresh herbs to fill the scores.
Now we add the salmon on top of the tray

of the beautiful veggies. Look at
this, this is so beautiful.
So now it's time to have it in the oven.

So i'm going bake this for 10 to 15 minutes, it's a
bit depending on the thickness of the

fillet of your fish, but make sure the
skin is crispy, that salmon is properly
cooked, and the veggies are soft.
So I'm now taking out the salmon. That's been cooked 12 minutes.

and what you actually see with
wild salmon is that the protein is

releasing a bit quicker than with
farmed salmon, which which is perfectly

okay so don't worry about that. Okay guys
this is it, it's so beautiful. It smells

perfect and if your child is younger
than Juul,

you perfectly could mash it
up for your family. All the

ingredients are soft and tender so it's
really easy to give it a bit of a mash
But we're going taste it Juul!
Mmmm!
